page.title: 05FARMING-RURAL-GALSTON
page.content: In the non-urban area of the block 67% of the land is intensively managed grassland eg.silage;crops 10%;enclosed rough grazing 15%;woodland 8%. Galston is a mainly farming district.There are 1125mm of rainfall every year and the soil and climate is suitable for growing rich green grass for grazing cows,silage making and hay.In the areas where the soil is well drained barley is grown.It is sown in March and harvested in September.The barley is fed to the stock and the straw is used for fodder or bedding. The two main breeds of cows are Ayrshire and Fresian.Some of the farmers have grey faced ewes which are put to the Suffolk tup round about September.The lambs being sold fat at Kimarnock,Lanark or Paisley market next June.
